alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 11:53AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Olmsted, Mower, western Wabasha and Dodge Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Prior Lake to Warsaw to near Easton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... West Concord around 1240 PM CDT. Mantorville around 1255 PM CDT. Oronoco and Mazeppa around 110 PM CDT. Austin around 120 PM CDT. Lyle around 125 PM CDT. Elgin and Rose Creek around 130 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Troy, Potsdam, Eden, Highway 57 And 570th Street, County Roads 6 And 15, Hidden Meadows R V Park, Rock Dell, Brookside Campground, County Roads 5 And 6 and Mayville. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 215. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
